question_content.author: Beilong Tang
choices: a. Line 3 is a comment, meaning that it will be ignored by the compiler.
b. To write a comment, we can use'//, /*, */, #' in Java.
c. If we do 'javac PrintArgs.java' and 'java PrintArgs Alice Bob', the output will be 'Alice'.
d. If we do 'javac PrintArgs.java' and 'java PrintArgs Alice Bob', the output will be 'Bob'.
e. If line 6 is changed to ' System.out.print(args[1]);System.out.print(args[0]); ', then the output will be 'BobAlice' if we do 'javac PrintArgs.java' and 'java PrintArgs Alice Bob'.
